WRITING.TEXT: You can buy Ethereum on Coinbase/Bitpanda and transfer it to Binance, Bittrex or Kraken and trade it for XLM

I have never had any issues with Binance so far... Only issue I have is that it doesn't hold all the coins I'd like to buy from there #128522; I think without verification you can withdraw coins for value up to 1BTC if you need more you'll have to get verified. My ID photo is really old - like long to short hair old and it worked like a charm #128522;

Once you login you can go to your dashboard and see what level verification are you at. Also on the same spot you can see what is the value of withdrawal. You should be able to trade cryptos without any problems without full verification.

If you decided to sell two of them(I hope to reinvest not to sell for fiat) and you are looking for short term gains I would exchange BTC to some altcoin of your choice :) and for LTC and DASH I'll leave that one to you as I think they both have huge potential but again it might be more long term investment then short term gains.

This is just my opinion - LTC is a great coin( I hold none atm ), it's fast, reliable, jumped a lot lately, managed to keep a decent value and I can only see it going up again. As BTC slows down and decreases in market cap it's only logical that crypto silver will grab a piece of that pie. I might be completely wrong but that's just my opinion. Anyhow if you feel better about DASH then follow your guts :)

Don't think anyone would be able to buy games without already being part of the crypto game. Imagine game costs 10 #8364; - to change 10 #8364; to ICX you have to buy btc/eth/ltc pay fee on let's say coinbase of 1 #8364; for transaction and whatever fee you have to pay for Visa transaction e.g. .5 #8364; this is already 15% of 10 #8364; down, send it off to an exchange you get ripped off there, change it to ICX you are ripped off again. Don't get me wrong this is the way to move towards mass adoption but it's not really an easy thing for newcomers to do without actually loosing money in the first place. Correct me if I am wrong of course! #128522;
I agree but that's the point. 20% is awesome but we are far away from getting where we want to be #128522; even tho I support these movements

WRITING.TITLE: Dwerve - Tower defense RPG

WRITING.TEXT: Hey guys! I've just published my first ever video :) I've stumbled upon this game on [kickstarter](https://back.dwerve.com/-6rze) and thought what better way to kickstart my channel than using a kickstarter game? :P Hope you like the video! Please leave any comments that may help me out in my journey! :)

Other than "just" fun, I play RPGs because it somehow manages to draw you into it's world, present you with different sets of values and allow you to work hard to be as good as you want to be. RPGs nowadays have great storylines, character designs and amazing gameplay. As much as playing games in general is fun there's also so much more to games than just fun.Just remember how you felt when hearing Ori and the blind forest story or how you felt while playing Journey at that final snow slope where you fell down and couldn't do anything to help and then finally you were brought back and pulled into this majestic final step in your journey. RPGs are so much more than "just fun".

WRITING.TITLE: Becoming a bird in The last campfire?

WRITING.TEXT: How you doing guys? It's Tom here and I would like you to join me on a journey through The last campfire. In this episode I finally get to meet Forest king and get to guess if he is good or in fact bad as I thought in previous episode. The Last Campfire is a puzzle adventure game where you play as an Ember that gets lost in a puzzling world. On its journey back home Ember has to solve puzzles and help forlorns(other embers that have lost their spark) to get their spark back. This game has a lot of hidden messages and has made me think about all the people that struggle with mental health and I hope my gameplay will help bring joy to everyones lives :) Thank you for watching and I will see you in the next one!
You lads are hilarious hahah love the series :) good job

How you doing guys ItsTom here and let's talk about Spellbreak! Spellbreak is a battle royale game with a magical twist. While Spellbreak covers all the basics of BR game like flying from the sky, gathering equipment and slaying all your enemies to be the last mage standing, there's something very different about Spellbreak. Gameplay mechanics is what separates Spellbreak from all other BR games. Combat in this game is so complex and interesting that you simply have to give this game a go. Just the pure joy of managing to exile someone even if you've lost the game is incredible! Thanks so much for tuning in and I'll see you in the next one :)

WRITING.TITLE: Is Amazon Luna killer of conventional gaming? Should we be excited? - my 2 cents

WRITING.TEXT: How you doing guys, ItsTom here and it's been couple days since amazon announced Luna cloud gaming service and I wanted to sit on this announcement to figure out if it's actually good or bad. I am hoping that this is finally a step in a good direction for cloud gaming! There's so much potential with cloud gaming that I can't wait to see if amazon can pull this off. And remember Amazon holds the largest share in cloud market... I think this would be an amazing way to get people with lower budgets to play triple A titles with low input latency. But we will have to wait and see how it all plays out since Stadia wasn't that greatly received and a lot of publsihers pulled out, hopefully that doesn't happen to Amazon. One thing I am afraid is that this service will see sing ups only when they launch games and loads of cancellations few weeks later. It might be a big struggle for Amazon to retain their audience. #8203; Anyhow join me in my video as I discuss pros and cons and why I think this is a step in the right direction!
Please do share if you agree/disagree about anything I've mentioned here :) I think it's good to hear what you all think about surge of new cloud gaming services and whats the future of them all :)

I've recently discussed this in a video on my youtube channel([ItsTom](https://youtu.be/GJYphnoASQw)) but I'll add my 2 cents here as well... I personally believe we are not going to see a huge surge of people jumping into cloud gaming boat at once. We are more likely to see parts of communities jumping into it. First group of people that will be jumping into cloud gaming will definitely be people that may not be able to afford expensive hardware to run all these new games. This group of people is the type of gamers that don't mind lower graphics quality nor to they mind 15-30ms latency input as they'd most likely be playing single player games anyway... After that initial group jumps on board(which some of them already have) we could see a group of people above them(casual gamers who buy consoles and latest hardware several months if not years after initial release) recognising that they could spend less on playing games through cloud services... If you look at Amazons revenue model which is subscription based and if their Ubisoft channel will be anywhere around 20-30$ a month we are talking about realistically saving 100s of $$$ for all the games you get to play. Just new Assassins Creed and Far Cry alone will cost you 120$ meaning playing these two games through cloud service will save you around 100$ :) I doubt we'll see that final group of gamers(hardcore gamers) jumping on board any time soon as for us it's not only the console or the game but it's part of our DNA or just part of who we are to be playing on xbox, playstation or pc. :) But I am pretty sure that if anyone can deliver a good experience with cloud gaming it's definitely the biggest cloud giant in the world Amazon(AWS) :)

WRITING.TITLE: Is cloud gaming taking over conventional gaming? - Amazon Luna my 2 cents

WRITING.TEXT: How you doing guys ItsTom here and couple of days ago amazon announced it's cloud gaming service Luna. I wanted to sleep it off for a day or two to go through my opinions and discuss it with myself if I think this is good or bad. In this video you'll hear me talking about pros and cons of Luna and cloud in general. Overall my opinion is that cloud gaming will be something important in gaming future so any new products and improvements to existing services is very well welcomed :) Great way for people that are not able to purchase expensive hardware and consoles to play AAA titles for a low price. Thanks for watching guys and I'll see you in the next one :)

How you doing guys! I've decided to chat about cloud gaming services and Amazon Luna in particular... Check it out and let me know some feedback! [https://youtu.be/GJYphnoASQw](https://youtu.be/GJYphnoASQw)

Amazing singing! Great vocals :) One thing I'd recommend is maybe looking at the camera here and there especially on that last video since it's more of a romantic video :)

Love your videos and information in the video :) I'd say try to figure out how to reduce sss sound in your vocals(not by not saying S but via editing tools :) ) other than that looks really nice! Also make sure to decrease music volume and increase your voice volume as music takes over your voice in several spots :)
Congrats! you'll be there quicker than you think! Share your channel here so I can help out a bit ;)

I've seen your channel couple days ago :) love the content, there's never enough horsepower! :) If you have any interest in the gaming I've just talked about cloud gaming Amazon Luna and I'd love if you'd check it out :) [https://youtu.be/GJYphnoASQw](https://youtu.be/GJYphnoASQw)

WRITING.TITLE: Is cloud gaming taking over consoles and PC?! - Amazon Luna

WRITING.TEXT: How you doing guys ItsTom here and I wanted to share my thoughts on Amazon Luna today :) Amazon announced Luna couple days ago and it seems that they could be bringing better performance than competitors but we'll have to wait and see. On the other hand I believe cloud gaming is a great way for people with lower financial power to play AAA titles for a fair price with potentially weaker graphics etc whilst still being able to play without latency issues etc. #8203; Hope you enjoy this one and I'll see you in the next one!
